titleStmt.title: Digital Edition of Glaser Abklatsch ID: AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1365
AT-OeAW-BA-3-27-A-GL1365

item.term: Early first millennium to the fourth century BC (predominance of Saba)
Fourth to first centuries BC (predominance of Qataban and Hadramawt, and their alliance with Main)
First century BC to early second century AD (alliances between the tribes of the high plateau and the ASA kingdoms)
Late second to late third centuries AD (wars among the Himyar, Saba and Hadramawt)
Fourth to sixth centuries AD (unification of Yemen under Himyarite rule)
It corresponds to the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans with sub-periods I-IV
First sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Second sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Third sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans
Fourth sub-period of the palaeographical divisions established by Jacques Ryckmans

graphic.desc: By kind permission of British Museum

1.[Saʿdīshams Yaʾ]zim and his brothers Burg Yuhar[ḥib] 2.[and …]nān of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān, leaders of the tribe of Sa[m-] 3.[ʿī,] two-[thirds] of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum, have dedicated to their patron-deity 4.[Taʾlab] Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, these four statues out of gratitude 5.[because] Taʾlab Riyāmum has [ful]filled all of the oracle[s which] 6.[they had sought] from him--and may Taʾlab Riyāmum continue to ful[fill and] 7.[grant] his [serv]ants of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān all the orac[les which] 8.[they might seek] from him; and out of gratitude because Taʾlab Riyāmum aided and [protected] 9.his servants Saʿdīshamsum and Burg of the line[age of Bataʿ] 10.[and Hamdān and] their two tribes of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum wh[en …] 11.[… Ra]ḥbatān from the town of Mārib in [… …] 12.[in the month of Dhū-]ʾAbhay from the revolt which broke out [… …] 13.[… … Mār]ib during that campaign. And may [… …]

Saʿdīshams Yaʾzim and his brothers Burg Yuharḥib
and …nān of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān, leaders of the tribe of Sam-
ʿī, two-thirds of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum, have dedicated to their patron-deity
Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, these four statues out of gratitude
because Taʾlab Riyāmum has fulfilled all of the oracles which
they had sought from him--and may Taʾlab Riyāmum continue to fulfill and
grant his servants of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān all the oracles which
they might seek from him; and out of gratitude because Taʾlab Riyāmum aided and protected
his servants Saʿdīshamsum and Burg of the lineage of Bataʿ
and Hamdān and their two tribes of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum when …
… Raḥbatān from the town of Mārib in … …
in the month of Dhū-ʾAbhay from the revolt which broke out … …
… … Mārib during that campaign. And may … …

Saʿdīshams Yaʾzim and his brothers Burg Yuharḥib
and …nān of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān, leaders of the tribe of Sam-
ʿī, two-thirds of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum, have dedicated to their patron-deity
Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, these four statues out of gratitude
because Taʾlab Riyāmum has fulfilled all of the oracles which
they had sought from him--and may Taʾlab Riyāmum continue to fulfill and
grant his servants of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān all the oracles which
they might seek from him; and out of gratitude because Taʾlab Riyāmum aided and protected
his servants Saʿdīshamsum and Burg of the lineage of Bataʿ
and Hamdān and their two tribes of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum when …
… Raḥbatān from the town of Mārib in … …
in the month of Dhū-ʾAbhay from the revolt which broke out … …
… … Mārib during that campaign. And may … …

Saʿdīshams Yaʾzim and his brothers Burg Yuharḥib
and …nān of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān, leaders of the tribe of Sam-
ʿī, two-thirds of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum, have dedicated to their patron-deity
Taʾlab Riyāmum, Lord of Turʿat, these four statues out of gratitude
because Taʾlab Riyāmum has fulfilled all of the oracles which
they had sought from him--and may Taʾlab Riyāmum continue to fulfill and
grant his servants of the lineage of Bataʿ and Hamdān all the oracles which
they might seek from him; and out of gratitude because Taʾlab Riyāmum aided and protected
his servants Saʿdīshamsum and Burg of the lineage of Bataʿ
and Hamdān and their two tribes of Ḥumlān and Ḥāshidum when …
… Raḥbatān from the town of Mārib in … …
in the month of Dhū-ʾAbhay from the revolt which broke out … …
… … Mārib during that campaign. And may … …
